name: RRB NTPC (Non-Technical Popular Categories)
description: A national-level recruitment examination conducted by the Railway Recruitment Boards (RRBs) to fill various non-technical posts in the Indian Railways. It includes both undergraduate (12th pass) and graduate-level posts like Junior Clerk, Accounts Clerk, Goods Guard, Station Master, etc.

eligibility.ageLimit: For Undergraduate Level posts (12th pass): 18 to 30 years. For Graduate Level posts: 18 to 33 years. Age relaxation is applicable for reserved categories (OBC, SC, ST, etc.) as per government rules.
eligibility.educationalQualification: For Undergraduate posts: 12th (+2 Stage) or its equivalent. For Graduate posts: A University Degree or its equivalent.
eligibility.nationality: A Citizen of India, or a subject of Nepal, or a subject of Bhutan, or a Tibetan refugee who came over to India before the 1st January 1962.

timeline.notificationDate: Expected between July and September 2024, as per the RRB Annual Calendar.
timeline.applicationEndDate: To be announced with the notification.
timeline.examDate: To be announced. The CBT-1 for the previous cycle (2019) was held from Dec 2020 to July 2021.
timeline.resultDate: To be announced after the examination.

stages.name: Stage 1: First Stage Computer Based Test (CBT-1)
stages.description: A common screening test for all posts. Duration: 90 minutes. Contains 100 objective questions on Mathematics, General Intelligence & Reasoning, and General Awareness. It is qualifying in nature.

stages.name: Stage 2: Second Stage Computer Based Test (CBT-2)
stages.description: Separate tests for different pay levels. Candidates shortlisted from CBT-1 appear for this. Duration: 90 minutes. Contains 120 objective questions on the same subjects as CBT-1 but with a higher difficulty level. Marks are considered for the final merit.

stages.name: Stage 3: Skill Test / Aptitude Test
stages.description: This stage is qualifying and post-specific. It includes a Computer Based Aptitude Test (CBAT) for Station Master and Traffic Assistant posts, and a Typing Skill Test (TST) for clerical posts.

stages.name: Stage 4: Document Verification and Medical Examination
stages.description: Candidates shortlisted based on their performance in CBT-2 and the skill test (where applicable) are called for DV and a medical fitness test.

examPattern.markingScheme: For both CBT-1 and CBT-2, 1 mark is awarded for each correct answer, and 1/3rd of a mark is deducted for each incorrect answer.

syllabus.name: General Awareness
topics: Current Events of National and International Importance
Physical, Social and Economic Geography of India and World
